item.title: Farah add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Instead of going to Paris to attend lectures, go to the public library, and you won't come out for twenty years, if you really wish to learn." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Farah add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "That is a good book it seems to me, which is opened with expectation and closed with profit." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Farah add a quote by Mary Schmich
item.description: "Reading is a discount ticket to everywhere. " -- Mary Schmich

item.title: Farah add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Farah add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Every man with a little leisure and enough money for railway tickets, every man, indeed, who knows how to read, has it in his power to magnify himself, to multiply the ways in which he exists, to make his life full, significant and interesting." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Farah add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Farah add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Farah add a quote by St. Augustine
item.description: "The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page." -- St. Augustine

item.title: Farah add a quote by Wendell Ford
item.description: "If information is the currency of democracy, then libraries are the banks." -- Wendell Ford

item.title: Farah add a quote by Margaret Fuller
item.description: "Today a reader, tomorrow a leader." -- Margaret Fuller

item.title: Farah add a quote by Helvy Tiana Rosa
item.description: "You are what you write." -- Helvy Tiana Rosa

item.title: Farah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Farah add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Farah add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I am enough of an artist to draw freely upon my imagination. Imagination is more important than knowledge. Knowledge is limited. Imagination encircles the world." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Farah add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Farah add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Farah add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm sick of just liking people. I wish to God I could meet somebody I could respect." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Farah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Farah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Farah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Farah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Farah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Farah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Farah add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Farah add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Farah add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "There is more stupidity than hydrogen in the universe, and it has a longer shelf life." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Farah add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "A mind is like a parachute. It doesn't work if it is not open." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Farah add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "The fact is always obvious much too late, but the most singular difference between happiness and joy is that happiness is a solid and joy a liquid." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Farah add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Farah add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Live simply so others may simply live." -- Mother Teresa
